"Table Game Odds" refers to the mathematical probabilities and statistical advantages associated with various casino table games. Understanding these odds is crucial for players aiming to make informed decisions and for casinos to maintain their house edge. This page provides an overview of the odds for popular table games such as Blackjack, Roulette, Baccarat, and Craps, highlighting the best and worst bets for players.

== Blackjack Odds and Basic Strategy ==
Blackjack is a card game where players aim to have a hand value closer to 21 than the dealer without exceeding it. The odds in Blackjack can vary based on the number of decks used and specific house rules. Basic strategy involves making decisions based on the player's hand and the dealer's visible card to minimize the house edge.

* '''House Edge''': Approximately 0.5% with optimal basic strategy
* '''Best Bet''': Following basic strategy
* '''Worst Bet''': Taking insurance

== Roulette Odds ==
Roulette is a game of chance where players bet on the outcome of a spinning wheel. There are two main types of roulette: European and American.

=== European Roulette ===
* '''House Edge''': 2.7%
* '''Best Bet''': Single number (payout 35:1)
* '''Worst Bet''': Five-number bet (only in American roulette)

=== American Roulette ===
* '''House Edge''': 5.26%
* '''Best Bet''': Single number (payout 35:1)
* '''Worst Bet''': Five-number bet (payout 6:1)

== Baccarat Odds ==
Baccarat involves betting on whether the Banker or Player hand will win, or if the result will be a Tie.

* '''Banker Bet''': House edge of 1.06%
* '''Player Bet''': House edge of 1.24%
* '''Tie Bet''': House edge of 14.36% (worst bet)

== Craps Odds ==
Craps is a dice game where players wager on the outcome of the roll, or a series of rolls, of two dice.

* '''Pass Line Bet''': House edge of 1.41%
* '''Don't Pass Bet''': House edge of 1.36%
* '''Best Bet''': Odds bet (no house edge)
* '''Worst Bet''': Any 7 (house edge of 16.67%)
